verses.text: 耶和華的威嚴和權能哈巴谷先知的禱告，配激動的音調。

words.note: Refers to divine authority and grandeur.
Can also be a verb 'to pray'.

verses.text: 耶和華啊！我聽見你的聲音，懼怕你的作為；求你在這些年間復興，在這些年間彰顯，發怒的時候以憐憫為懷。

words.note: More formal than 害怕.
Refers to actions, especially divine ones.
Lit. 'to hold in the bosom/heart'.

verses.text: 神由提幔而來，聖者從巴蘭山臨到。（細拉）他的榮光瀰漫穹蒼，讚美他的聲音響徹大地。

words.note: Refers to the singular God of Abrahamic religions.
Often used after a prepositional phrase.
Implies a divine or significant arrival.
A Hebrew word of uncertain meaning, often interpreted as a pause.
Describes a widespread, encompassing presence.
A poetic term for the heavens.
Implies sound filling a space completely.

verses.text: 他的輝煌如光，手中四射光芒，就在其中隱藏著能力。

words.note: Used for magnificent brightness or achievement.

words.definition: to radiate, shoot in all directions

words.note: Often used for metaphorical or poetic light.

verses.text: 瘟疫在他面前行走，災病在他腳下發出。

words.note: Often used in historical or biblical contexts.
Used metaphorically here as 'preceding'.
Often refers to pestilence or sickness as divine judgment.

verses.text: 他站立，震撼全地；他觀看，驚散列國。永在的山崩裂，長存的嶺塌陷；他的道路存到永遠。

words.note: Refers to all nations collectively.

verses.text: 我看見古珊的帳棚遭難，米甸地的帳幕驚惶。
耶和華啊！你騎上你的馬，乘駕得勝的戰車，難道是惱怒江河、向江河發怒、是向海洋洩憤？

words.note: Implies rhetorical question, 'Don't tell me...'

verses.text: 你的弓顯露，你的箭上弦。（原文意義不明，這句參考RSV,Job等譯本翻譯）（細拉）你裂開大地為江河。

words.note: A modern English Bible translation.
Refers to the biblical book.
A Hebrew word of unknown meaning, possibly a musical or liturgical direction.

verses.text: 諸山見你而顫抖，眾水暴流而過；深淵發聲，舉手高揚。

words.note: Used to denote plurality in classical/biblical Chinese.
Connects clauses, often implying a logical consequence.
Used to denote plurality or multitude.

verses.text: 日月停在本位，你的箭發射如光；你的矛閃爍輝耀。

words.note: Often used in poetic or elevated contexts.

verses.text: 你激憤踐踏全地，你懷怒打碎列國。

words.note: Describes a state of strong emotion, here divine wrath.
Refers to the entire world or land.
Lit. 'harbor anger,' often used for divine wrath in scripture.
Refers to multiple nations, often gentile nations in biblical context.

verses.text: 你出來救拔子民，拯救你所膏立的。你擊打惡人的房頂，使根基全然顯露。（細拉）

words.note: Often used in the sense of 'pulling out of distress' or 'delivering.'
Often refers to God's chosen people.
Indicates the following verb is the object of the preceding clause or nominalizes it.
A key religious act of consecration and setting apart.
Turns the verb phrase '你所膏立' into 'those whom you have anointed.'
Common term in the Bible for those who oppose God.
Emphasizes totality.
Referring to descendants of Noah's son Shem.
Abbreviation for '以賽亞書' (Book of Isaiah).
Abbreviation for '詩篇' (Book of Psalms).
Often used metaphorically for God as a solid foundation.
A musical or liturgical term, likely indicating a pause.

verses.text: 你用他的槍，刺透他戰士的頭。他們來如暴風，把我們驅散。他們的喜好，是暗中吞噬窮人。

words.note: Used to bring the object before the verb for emphasis or clarity.
Conveys a sense of consuming completely.

verses.text: 你乘馬馳騁海上，大水洶湧翻騰。

words.note: Often used in a literary or poetic context, implying speed and freedom.
Can refer to a large body of water or a flood.
Describes powerful, agitated movement of water.
Describes violent, upward and turning motion, like waves.

verses.text: 我一聽見，就全身發抖；因這聲音，我嘴唇震顫。腐爛侵蝕我骨，我在站立之地戰兢。我靜候災難之日，犯境的民上來。

words.note: Literary possessive or attributive particle, similar to 'de'.
Literary possessive or attributive particle, similar to 'de'.

verses.text: 信心之歌無花果樹縱不發芽，葡萄樹不結果，橄欖樹無所出，田裡無收成，圈內的羊被剪除，棚裡也沒有牛，

words.note: Literary possessive or attributive particle, similar to 'de'.
Literally 'not have what to produce'.
Locative particle often suffixed to nouns.
Locative particle often suffixed to nouns.

verses.text: 我卻要因耶和華歡喜，以救我的 神為樂。

words.note: Literary/formal use, often in '以...為...' structure.

verses.text: 主耶和華是我的力量，他使我的腳快如母鹿的蹄，在高地上行走。交詩班長，用絲弦的樂器伴奏。

words.note: Refers to the leader of the choir or musicians in ancient Israel.
